channel.title: Need help with portforward!
channel.description: Ok so i portforwarded right because runelocus says that it is online...so when i wanna play my client i use ip 127.0.0.1 and give everyone else the client with my no-ip address?? Also my brother wants to play on his laptop..but he cant connect to the no-ip so what ip does he connect from??? it says it got his connection but just keeps saying...connecting to server...

item.title: Need help with portforward!
item.dc:creator: @barelydead_owner barelydead owner
item.description:
@barelydead_owner wrote:

ok sorry but you al ldont know what you are talking about. it seems to me none of you know what your talking about the host can log on using the ip dont need to use 127.0.0.1
as long as you change the ip on ur client and server such as 0.0.0.0 or the old ip it was originaly on if you leeched and you port foward correctly you should be fine but if your having problems with this post the type of router you have and i will give you a link to a video tutorial that will simplify this for you

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with portforward!
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

By using the same port of 127.0.0.1, since you guys are connected to the same network.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with portforward!
item.dc:creator: @thehorrors thehorrors
item.description:
@thehorrors wrote:

I had a problem sorta like this. on the client that you are going to use replace what ever youve put down
eg: “stabface.no-ip.org” with “0.0.0.0”

this worked for me.

im guessing you have not done the port forward right.

1)try the defult gateway etc there are many tuts using this

OR

  1. go into controll panel --> Network and sharing center --> view status --> details --> look for your IPv4 IP Address.
    itll be something like 192.168.1.—
    the — will be the numbers at the end it.
    type 192.168.1.1 in ur browser
    apps and gaming
    then type the last few number tht you saw on your IPv4 IP address.

you will also need to do something with ur firewall to let the connections though i think.

this worked for me, hope it does for you. sorry im not so great with words =p

cheerz

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with portforward!
item.dc:creator: @ipkudown ipkudown
item.description:
@ipkudown wrote:

i was get the same proplem but there one his name is alex ( the best i can say ) helped me how to do that

you the hoster right ?

go to your client files to gui

and change it to 127.0.0.1

becuase the hoster can’t go in his no-ip only in 127.0.0.1

but your players who wana play it should to use that no-ip

for example your ip in gui file is
127.0.0.1

your friend

@@@@.no-ip.!!!

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with portforward!
item.dc:creator: @Opium10 Opium10
item.description:
@Opium10 wrote:

Windows XP - Go to “Start” then go to “Run” Then type in Cmd.exe.

Windows 7/Vista - Go to “Start” then type in the little search bar down the bottom and type Cmd.exe.
[hr]
Now type, Ipconfig. Now it should look like this

[center][/center]

Where it says Default Gateway There should be some numbers. Type them in your browser
Now You need to figure this bit out yourself.

Because I’m not sure what router your using and all routers are different, Hope this helped.

Read full topic
